comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: poor Louvain, the church was noted for the fire that destroyed it www.firstworldwar.com/battles/louvain.htm video of the sack of Louvain here www.firstworldwar.com/video/sackoflouvain.htm

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.firstworldwar.com/battles/louvain.htm According to this website, The Belgian city of Louvain was occupied by the Germans on August 19, 1914. The Belgians attacked on August 25 and the Germans retaliated by burning and looting the city for 5 days.
